=== Welcome! ===
This is the wiki page of the Maine Local Community Team. We aim to provide free community support to users of the various flavours of Ubuntu as well as advocating the use of Ubuntu to individuals and organisations alike. We keep in touch via our active <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-us-me|email list]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[MaineTeam-IRC|IRC]]</nowiki> chatroom. This group is for anyone in the Maine (but we welcome non-Maine residents) who uses or is interested in some flavour of Ubuntu or one of its derivitives. This group is for people of all technical abilities from I've-never-heard-of-linux all the way to I'm-an-Ubuntu-Master.

=== How do I join? ===
There is no official process to join, however if you join the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/people/ubuntu-maine|launchpad team]]</nowiki> you are then able to vote in polls organised by the group. Discussion happens on the <nowiki>[[http://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-maine|mailing list]]</nowiki> which you are free to join. There is also an active group of members who chat in real time on <nowiki>[[MaineTeam-IRC|IRC]]</nowiki> in the #ubuntu-maine channel on <nowiki>[[MaineTeam-IRC|IRC]]</nowiki>.freenode.net.

=== Meetings ===
Meetings for ubuntu-maine usually happen once a month, in #ubuntu-maine-meeting on <nowiki>[[MaineTeam-IRC|IRC]]</nowiki>.freenode.net. 

The next meeting agenda is located on <nowiki>[[MaineTeamMeetingAgenda]]</nowiki>. Please feel free to read this before the meeting, or add your own agenda items. 

Minutes of the last meeting can be found at <nowiki>[[MaineTeam-LastMeeting]]</nowiki>, and previous meetings are documented on <nowiki>[[MaineTeam-MeetingNotes]]</nowiki>.

=== Support ===
There is a whole load of documentation at <nowiki>[[http://help.ubuntu.com/]]</nowiki> but feel free to ask a question on the <nowiki>[[http://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-maine|mailing list]]</nowiki> or in <nowiki>[[MaineTeam-[[MaineTeam-IRC|IRC]]</nowiki>|<nowiki>[[MaineTeam-IRC|IRC]]</nowiki>]] if you need help with anything. We also maintain a list of some Maine-specific <nowiki>[[MaineTeam-Hardware| hardware support]]</nowiki>. Support is also available from the <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/support|global Ubuntu community]]</nowiki>

If you intend to help support new users, please consider adopting the <nowiki>[[MaineTeam-Support_Guidelines|Support Guidelines]]</nowiki>
